intro: Phlomis herba-venti, commonly known as windy herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and lavender. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Phlomis herba-venti is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
